alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Richland (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 9:34PM CDT until August 02 at 12:45AM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM CDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHERN JASPER AND RICHLAND COUNTIES... At 934 PM CDT, the public reported flash flooding across the warned area. Up to 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Olney, Newton, Ste. Marie, Parkersburg, Claremont, Calhoun, Wheeler, Dundas, West Liberty, Bogota, Wakefield, Olney Noble Airport, Newton Lake, Latona and Berryville. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
